metadata.title: CVE-2019-9514 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Some HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to a reset flood, potentiallyleading to a denial of service. The attacker opens a number of streams andsends an invalid request over each stream that should solicit a stream ofRST_STREAM frames from the peer. Depending on how the peer queues theRST_STREAM frames, this can consume excess memory, CPU, or both.

criterions.comment: golang-1.6 package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.10 package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
grpc package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
golang-google-grpc package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
trafficserver package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
nodejs: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'changes too intrusive').
